A DAY of music, food, talks, workshops, open homes, poetry, theatre, films, family friendly activities and more.

Friday 31st March – Sunday 2nd April 2017

Various locations across Greater Manchester

Skip to main content

Main Energise
Festival Midday-8pm,
Saturday 1st April 2017

Hulme Community Garden Centre,
28 Old Birley Street,
Manchester M15 5RG

The Polytunnel

This warm space, full of plants winding and growing in the heat, will be the backdrop for discussion on a range of hot topics and controversial issues within the environmental movement. A place to take a moment to connect with nature through drawing and to think about local cam- paigns and global energy justice.

The Art of Seeing

Saturday 1st April 2017
15:00 – 16:30

An exercise in drawing as ‘deep looking’. Rather than creating ‘good’ drawings we will spend time looking closely at our plant subject; to gain a deeper appreciation of how the plants form relates to its function. Drawing/Seeing meditation was a favourite method of Frederick Franck (1909-2006).

The Art of Seeing

Saturday 1st April 2017
15:00 – 16:30

An exercise in drawing as ‘deep looking’. Rather than creating ‘good’ drawings we will spend time looking closely at our plant subject; to gain a deeper appreciation of how the plants form relates to its function. Drawing/Seeing meditation was a favourite method of Frederick Franck (1909-2006).

Barrow Down stage

This 'ramshackle chic' main stage will host a mix of local talent including KS Roosevelt, The Happy Soul, and the WAST Choir. We will be firing up the pizza oven and stocking treats at the community cafe and other foodie joints. Moss Cider will be assisting the revelry with their locally-sourced apple-based drinks (non-apple based drinks also available).
